result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse William Johnston II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 03-12-2020 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant sentenced to serve FORTY-FIVE (45) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with credit for FORTY-FIVE (45) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse William Johnston II

records.addlTxt: Completion of Representation.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Jesse William Johnston in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Jesse William Johnston in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Court proceeded to Sentencing in Branch 33.

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve FORTY-FIVE (45) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with credit for FORTY-FIVE (45) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 03-12-2020 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements / Jury Instructions.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court via-telephone, defendant Jesse William Johnston not in court, in custody and not produced.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel is ill to today's proceedings. For reasons stated on the record, Court takes motion to revoke DPA agreement by the state under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for March 12, 2018 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jesse William Johnston in court with attorney Daniel J Sevcik.  Defendant Jesse William Johnston in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  ec   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2018 at 08:30 am.

  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jesse William Johnston in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Jesse William Johnston in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BROSTROM, Branch 6.  All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant was recently hospitalized.   Court lifts the stay on the warrant. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.      Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant does not appear.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 7/13/15 @ 10:00am
